body:
Obviously you guys (the community) are aware of the Manager assignments that we have released to you all in the policies post, but I will be making this post to confirm to everyone of what the Managers and Administrators are doing on the server. 

Arigenn --> 

Administrative Task
- Managing Staff Warn Document 
Administrative Role
- Managing Support Email 
Administrative Assignment
- Server Development

Rinn -->

Administrative Task
- Managing Staff Training
Administrative Role
- Managing Training Documents
Administrative Assignment 
- Community 

John -->

Management Task
- Managing Staff spotlight 
Management Role
- Maintaining the Assignment System
Management Assignment
- Community 

Fouled --> 

Management Task 
- Managing Staff Calendars
Management Role 
- Managing Senior Moderators 
Management Assignment
- Server Development 

Keep in mind if you have any issues regarding a section of the server, to direct it to the appropriate manager or administrator. If you have any questions regarding these, please feel free to address them.

title: Management Assignments

replies.body: I'm still finding the manager rank shit
replies.body_tagged: I'm still finding the manager rank shit

replies.body:
So much bureaucracy for such a small server.
Dont overcomplicate things. 

For example, the staff spotlight does not need to be an official managerial role. 

The staff spotlight was created to make the community more familiar with specific staff members in a casual way.

It's definitely not important enough to be an administrative task.

Unnecessary bureaucracy will cause confusion and frustration.
replies.body_tagged:
So much bureaucracy for such a small server.
Dont overcomplicate things. 

For example, the staff spotlight does not need to be an official managerial role. 

The staff spotlight was created to make the community more familiar with specific staff members in a casual way.

It's definitely not important enough to be an administrative task.

Unnecessary bureaucracy will cause confusion and frustration.

replies.body:
Wtf are senior mods doing then? Just ditch this pink rank and split the jobs equally among the seniors. Right now I don't see the point of having two separate ranks when it doesn't look like anyone but you is doing anything. Seriously making little sub tasks are only good if they get done.

And for the love of god I see all the seniors on the forums everyday and hardly post anything (expect for Greg & Seth). Don't say they are doing appeals/reports cause they don't take that long to complete just be more active engaging with discussions while your on the forums. Also for the love of god answer my report >_< its been over a week. I'm not hating on the staff but seriously things are being over complicated.

replies.body:
Like I mentioned to you in Slack, I feel you are focussing way to much on this gritty policy stuff. I understand the leadership team (my name for admins + managers) want to revamp the entire staff policy in order to have a strong base before they start work on more practical projects, however it's been long enough and you need to actually focus on improving moderators, developing moderation systems and creating a more diverse, thorough moderation team. 
     I don't agree with some of the jobs you've listed such as Staff Spotlight, you don't need an entire role for this.
Who does the appeals and reports? The seniors?
     Furthermore am I tripping or did I not see a staff team assignments? Or are you all sharing staff jobs? Please don't tell me the seniors are doing that, because personally I think replacing server development with staff team would be better, but you know a lot more than me so I'll respect whatever you decide.

Please don't tell me the seniors are doing that, because personally I think replacing server development with staff team would be better, but you know a lot more than me so I'll respect whatever you decide.

replies.body:
And all this "wonderful" team can't reply to my application for 10 days. Lol.

"..what the Managers and Administrators are doing on the server." If you want people to not ask such questions, you have to make your job and team open to the community. And imo, you shouldn't divide your roles in staff team. If one is absent, other can do his job.

replies.body:
Yes, you should only see your staff application if you've posted one, if not then it should be clear. 
The Staff Apps Q&A and Application format and criteria can be located in "Guides and Support".

replies.body: For all Senior members to put in their input on your app, review your app, and deal with maybe at least 30 more apps, deal with their assigned duties and in game problems. I wouldn't think that they are going to respond in a week. It's a process. Wait patiently.

replies.body: It takes long because almost every player that checks the forums wants to be a staff member. A good amount out of the group gets the "Reviewing" tag and it takes time for staff to go through each one and talk about that players strengths and weaknesses. Its not a thing that you can take 2 seconds on, its a process. Always expect a response after 2-3 days, never bump a post.
